"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2017-06-16 13:20:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/d6c2917c8c8da1fb334569b94bad7d5b324cbb12', 'message': '[WIP] Metadata agent support in networking-ovn

Initial implementation

Changes in the mechanism driver:

    * Automatically create a port with device_owner=network:dhcp to
      serve metadata and eventually DHCP.
    * Auto-allocate an IP for the metadata port on subnet creation.
    * Push static route for 169.254.169.254 in DHCP options.
    * Wait until metadata service is provisioned in the chassis where
      a port resides before sending the event to Nova.

Agent:

    * Implementation of [0]

Devstack plugin:

    * Starts networking-ovn-agent with the proper config files.
    * Disables config drive in nova.conf.
    * Disables TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION

TODO:

    * Write tests.
    * Check that tempest passes with metadata service enabled.

In order to test this patch out we need to make this changes to
nova.conf:

    * [DEFAULT] section:
      force_config_drive = False
    * [neutron] section:
      service_metadata_proxy = True

This patch depends on [1] (already merged into OVS master) and [2].

[0]
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/design/metadata_api.html
[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/767369/
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/771297/

Change-Id: Ife2fd18f2f88050429e70c7e557fa41d2d54b034

commit_message:
Metadata agent support in networking-ovn

Initial implementation

Changes in the mechanism driver:

    * Automatically create a port with device_owner=network:dhcp to
      serve metadata and eventually DHCP.
    * Auto-allocate an IP for the metadata port on subnet creation.
    * Push static route for 169.254.169.254 in DHCP options.
    * Wait until metadata service is provisioned in the chassis where
      a port resides before sending the event to Nova.

Agent:

    * Implementation of [0].

Devstack plugin:

    * Starts networking-ovn-agent with the proper config files.
    * Disables config drive in nova.conf for tempest against master
      branch.
    * Enables TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION for tempest against master branch.

In order to test this patch out we need to make these changes to
nova.conf:

    * [DEFAULT] section:
      force_config_drive = False
    * [neutron] section:
      service_metadata_proxy = True

This patch depends on [1] and [2] (already merged into OVS master).
NOTE: Metadata tests are only enabled for the non-voting tempest job
      which runs against OVS master branch. The release job runs against
      OVS 2.7 which doesn't include [1][2] so those tests are disabled
      until OVS 2.8 is released.

[0]
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/design/metadata_api.html
[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/767369/
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/771297/

Change-Id: Ife2fd18f2f88050429e70c7e557fa41d2d54b034

commit_message:
Remove .testrepository/times.dbm

When we run tox -e py27 command and after that
we run tox -e py35 command, we will meet with
test fail problem like: "No module named gdbm".
This patch adds cleaning up of this file
before running next tests.

Change-Id: I35a20521706b19a3067a5579c9dcf46efd0d55c0

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2017-06-29 20:28+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2017-07-13 11:51+0000\n"msgid "" "Setting up an external network is described in `OpenStack Administrator " "Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/networking-adv-features." "html>`_. Assuming the external network to be used for the auto-allocation " "feature is named ``public``, make it the ``default`` external network with " "the following command:" msgstr "" "Menyiapkan jaringan eksternal dijelaskan pada `OpenStack Administrator Guide " "<http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/networking-adv-features.html>` _. " "Dengan asumsi jaringan eksternal yang akan digunakan untuk fitur alokasi " "otomatis dinamakan ``public``, jadikan jaringan eksternal ``default`` dengan " "perintah berikut:" "The flag ``--default`` (and ``--no-default`` flag) is only effective with " "external networks and has no effects on regular (or internal) networks." msgstr "" "Flag ``--default`` (and ``--no-default`` flag) hanya efektif dengan " "jaringan eksternal dan tidak memiliki efek pada jaringan reguler (atau " "internal)." msgid """You can virtualize these nodes for demonstration, training, or proof-of-" "concept purposes. However, you must use physical hosts for evaluation of " "performance or scaling." msgstr "" "Anda dapat melakukan virtualisasi simpul ini untuk tujuan demonstrasi, " "pelatihan, atau proof-of-concept. Namun, Anda harus menggunakan host fisik " "untuk mengevaluasi kinerja atau penskalaan." msgid ""

commit_message:
Refactor evacuators

Allow the evacuators part to be able to do more and to freely evacuate
different types of the workloads(full compute, vms, ...)

Change-Id: I2e8b23a48504b8e4ea13f6b86cb9689d9bab5cf1
Depends-On: I5272ca90d806b8ce83055199724abdc14fe414bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-dr refs/changes/28/483528/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: evacuated_nodes, failed_nodes = evac.evacuate(nodes) LOG.debug("Successfully evacuated nodes {0}".format(evacuated_nodes)) LOG.debug("Failed to evacuate nodes {0}".format(failed_nodes)) failed_nodes = evac.get_nodes_details(failed_nodes) notifier.notify(failed_nodes, 'error')

commit_message:
Refactoring fencers

Allow freezer-dr to load fencers more generically and give the drivers
space to implement their own fencing procedure

Change-Id: I5272ca90d806b8ce83055199724abdc14fe414bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-dr refs/changes/77/483477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from freezer_dr.common.yaml_parser import YamlParserimport libvirtimport time def __init__(self, nodes, fencer_conf): super(LibvirtDriver, self).__init__(nodes, fencer_conf) self.parser = YamlParser(self.fencer_conf['credentials_file']) # initiate libvirt connection conn_name = self.fencer_conf.get('name', None) def force_shutdown(self, node): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=node.get('domain-name')) def graceful_shutdown(self, node): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=node.get('domain-name')) def status(self, node): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=node.get('domain-name')) def get_node_details(self, node): """Loads the node's fencing information from ``credentials_file`` :param node: a dict contains node ip or hostname :return: a dict contains node fencing information """ node_details = self.parser.find_server_by_ip(node.get('ip')) or \ self.parser.find_server_by_hostname(node.get('host')) return node_details def fence(self): """Implements the fencing procedure for server fencing using ipmi :return: a list of nodes and weather they're fenced or not! """ fenced_nodes = [] for node in self.nodes: LOG.debug("fencing node {0}".format(node)) # load node details node_details = self.get_node_details(node) # loop on the node number of n times trying to fence it gently, # if not force it! for retry in range(0, self.fencer_conf['retries']): if self.status(node=node_details): try: self.graceful_shutdown(node=node_details) except Exception as e: LOG.debug(e) else: node['status'] = True break time.sleep(self.fencer_conf['hold_period']) LOG.info('wait for %d seconds before retrying to gracefully ' 'shutdown' % self.fencer_conf['hold_period']) try: self.force_shutdown(node=node_details) except Exception as e: LOG.error(e) if not self.status(node=node_details): node['status'] = True else: node['status'] = False fenced_nodes.append(node) return fenced_nodes 'version': 1.1, 'author': 'Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Company, L.P'
deleted_lines: import libvirt def __init__(self, node, **kwargs): super(LibvirtDriver, self).__init__(node, **kwargs) conn_name = kwargs.get('name', None) def force_shutdown(self): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=self.node.get('domain-name')) def graceful_shutdown(self): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=self.node.get('domain-name')) def status(self): target = self.connection.lookupByName(name=self.node.get('domain-name')) 'version': 1.0, 'author': 'Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P'

commit_message:
Make puppet-openstackci beaker jobs voting

For some reason puppet-openstackci was singled out as nonvoting,
probably because it was one of the first repos to get this job in the
first place. We missed it in the make-beaker-voting-everywhere patch, so
this patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I1b8705e43612f46220d83cf7d368ea143ecde7dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/38/482938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ovsdbapp to PROJECTS

This patch is adding ovsdbapp to the $PROJECTS variable so it can be
installed from git, without it the job fails with:

The /opt/stack/new/ovsdbapp project was not found; if this is a gate job,
add the project to the $PROJECTS variable in the job definition.

Change-Id: I5b60222090b3f4827091b7a96d8696adb8e12c7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/06/483406/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export PROJECTS="openstack/ovsdbapp $PROJECTS"

commit_message:
Add networking-sfc to PROJECTS for Tricircle

Driver for networking-sfc has been added to Tricircle, need to
add networking-sfc to PROJECTS variable to allow DevStack to
clone networking-sfc so Tricircle's dsvm test can proceed.

Change-Id: I7c18aee7074b83ff3ab5aaf3509647893e395ec7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/54/483754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export PROJECTS="openstack/networking-sfc $PROJECTS"

commit_message:
scripts: jenkins-sudo-grep: Look at /var/log/messages for sudo logs

The rsyslog package on openSUSE uses /var/log/messages for the sudo logs
so add this file as an alternative to the auth.log and secure ones.

Change-Id: I1af5a7a56590935585ac9684d90c2e7c90f09975
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/49/483549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # the auth.log or secure log or messages files before and after a test run.elif [ -f /var/log/messages ]; then OLDLOGFILE=$( ls /var/log/messages-* | sort | tail -n1 ) LOGFILE=/var/log/messages.log echo "*** Could not find auth.log/secure/messages log for sudo tracing"
deleted_lines: # the auth.log or secure log files before and after a test run. echo "*** Could not find auth.log/secure log for sudo tracing"

commit_message:
Fix duplicate Neutron ports on instance reschedule

Because network allocate is an async call, and instance metadata
is updated in place [1], network_allocated tag in instance system metadata
may be removed in some race conditions, so when instance rescheculed
multiple ips will be allocated [2].

[1]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2820-L2823
[2]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L1429-L1430

Change-Id: I93c1c447e79c78bf91023cb1231d553351437d9f
Closes-bug: #1609526

commit_message:
Correct help in --profile argument

HMAC key of OSprofiler can be configure in config files of Trove
not in api-paste.ini (configs in paste are deprecated).

Change-Id: I4904e5d0104e1cac12cc1f3e6dc38b6ef8372982

Workflow check_pre_deployment_validations, sends multiple messages,
as part of the sub workflow execution. If the workflow is success,

Change-Id: I3f14a3bc97fa1e51230e1f6b1de4ed4fb8205842

commit_message:
Avoid empty print during validation workflow execution

Workflow check_pre_deployment_validations, sends multiple messages,
as part of the sub workflow execution. If the workflow is success,
there are no messages sent and it will be empty string. Avoid
printing empty strings.

Change-Id: I3f14a3bc97fa1e51230e1f6b1de4ed4fb8205842

commit_message:
Add sla section to samples

Add missing sla section and proper hacking rule
Change was done by script http://ideone.com/M3Broy

Closes-bug: #1554857

Change-Id: Ic0099833d02b246961a714cf096ffba2594097a8

commit_message:
Add missing DockerMysqlClientConfigImage

The change Ieaedac33f0a25a352ab432cdb00b5c888be4ba27 requires an entry
so that the heat parameter is populated.

Change-Id: Id724e294eadaf01d61038c6436a383969c4653d7

commit_message:
Request service token using identity v3

This patch makes freezer-api request its service token to an Identity v3
endpoint (using Password plugin) and adds Password options to the config
sample file.

Change-Id: I37cec5564589f83fc4020fbc9269730ab0882b3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/42/304742/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Config Section from which to load plugin specific options (unknown # value)# Authentication URL (unknown value) #auth_url = <None> # Domain ID to scope to (unknown value) #domain_id = <None> # Domain name to scope to (unknown value) #domain_name = <None> # Project ID to scope to (unknown value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/tenant-id #project_id = <None> # Project name to scope to (unknown value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/tenant-name #project_name = <None> # Domain ID containing project (unknown value) #project_domain_id = <None> # Domain name containing project (unknown value) #project_domain_name = <None> # Trust ID (unknown value) #trust_id = <None> # Optional domain ID to use with v3 and v2 parameters. It will be used # for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2 # authentication. (unknown value) #default_domain_id = <None> # Optional domain name to use with v3 API and v2 parameters. It will # be used for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2 # authentication. (unknown value) #default_domain_name = <None> # User id (unknown value) #user_id = <None> # Username (unknown value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/user-name #username = <None> # User's domain id (unknown value) #user_domain_id = <None> # User's domain name (unknown value) #user_domain_name = <None> # User's password (unknown value) #password = <None>
deleted_lines: # Complete public Identity API endpoint. (string value) #auth_uri = <None> # API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. (string value) #auth_version = <None> # Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but delegate the # authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. (boolean value) #delay_auth_decision = false # Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API server. (integer # value) #http_connect_timeout = <None> # How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating with Identity # API Server. (integer value) #http_request_max_retries = 3 # Env key for the swift cache. (string value) #cache = <None> # Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) #certfile = <None> # Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) #keyfile = <None> # A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections. # Defaults to system CAs. (string value) #cafile = <None> # Verify HTTPS connections. (boolean value) #insecure = false # The region in which the identity server can be found. (string value) #region_name = <None> # Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. (string value) #signing_dir = <None> # Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for caching. If left # undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. (list value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/memcache_servers #memcached_servers = <None> # In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the middleware # caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set # to -1 to disable caching completely. (integer value) #token_cache_time = 300 # Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is retrieved # from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of revocation events # combined with a low cache duration may significantly reduce performance. # (integer value) #revocation_cache_time = 10 # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated or # authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with HMAC) # in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. (string value) # Allowed values: None, MAC, ENCRYPT #memcache_security_strategy = None # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is # used for key derivation. (string value) #memcache_secret_key = <None> # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is # tried again. (integer value) #memcache_pool_dead_retry = 300 # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. (integer value) #memcache_pool_maxsize = 10 # (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached # server. (integer value) #memcache_pool_socket_timeout = 3 # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the # pool before it is closed. (integer value) #memcache_pool_unused_timeout = 60 # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. (integer value) #memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout = 10 # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x. (boolean value) #memcache_use_advanced_pool = false # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will not # set the X-Service-Catalog header. (boolean value) #include_service_catalog = true # Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to: "disabled" # to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to validate binding # information if the bind type is of a form known to the server and ignore it # if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind type is unknown the token # will be rejected. "required" any form of token binding is needed to be # allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that must be present in tokens. # (string value) #enforce_token_bind = permissive # If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. This requires # that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. (boolean value) #check_revocations_for_cached = false # Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single algorithm # or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python standard # hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put the # preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will be # stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while # migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all the old # tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for better # performance. (list value) #hash_algorithms = md5 # Prefix to prepend at the beginning of the path. Deprecated, use identity_uri. # (string value) #auth_admin_prefix = # Host providing the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. # (string value) #auth_host = 127.0.0.1 # Port of the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. # (integer value) #auth_port = 35357 # Protocol of the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. # (string value) # Allowed values: http, https #auth_protocol = https # Complete admin Identity API endpoint. This should specify the unversioned # root endpoint e.g. https://localhost:35357/ (string value) #identity_uri = <None> # This option is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Single # shared secret with the Keystone configuration used for bootstrapping a # Keystone installation, or otherwise bypassing the normal authentication # process. This option should not be used, use `admin_user` and # `admin_password` instead. (string value) #admin_token = <None> # Service username. (string value) #admin_user = <None> # Service user password. (string value) #admin_password = <None> # Service tenant name. (string value) #admin_tenant_name = admin # Config Section from which to load plugin specific options (unknown value)

commit_message:
[Gate] Remove releases older than Boron

There's no gate jobs to test these releases anymore, removing them to
simplify the gate scripts

Change-Id: I613827dccb979b7a14b200aee98c963e663dea08

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I225da4f95187387007df11c91047497a2a93e862
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/86/408886/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key, value in headers.items(): headers = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in headers.items())
deleted_lines: for key, value in six.iteritems(headers): headers = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in six.iteritems(headers))

commit_message:
import content from cli-reference in openstack-manuals

The following commands are provided by the neutron repo,
so the corresponding CLI references are imported here.

- neutron-sanity-check
- neutron-debug

The purpose of this commit is just to import the CLI reference
related to the neutron repo as-is.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib514b3653cff615ee5b14e087fdd5985d7c4285b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/480064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This file is manually generated, unlike many of the other chapters. ======================================== neutron-sanity-check command-line client ======================================== The :command:`neutron-sanity-check` client is a tool that checks various sanity about the Networking service. This chapter documents :command:`neutron-sanity-check` version ``10.0.0``. neutron-sanity-check usage ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: neutron-sanity-check [-h] [--arp_header_match] [--arp_responder] [--bridge_firewalling] [--config-dir DIR] [--config-file PATH] [--debug] [--dhcp_release6] [--dibbler_version] [--dnsmasq_version] [--ebtables_installed] [--icmpv6_header_match] [--ip6tables_installed] [--ip_nonlocal_bind] [--iproute2_vxlan] [--ipset_installed] [--keepalived_ipv6_support] [--log-config-append PATH] [--log-date-format DATE_FORMAT] [--log-dir LOG_DIR] [--log-file PATH] [--noarp_header_match] [--noarp_responder] [--nobridge_firewalling] [--nodebug] [--nodhcp_release6] [--nodibbler_version] [--nodnsmasq_version] [--noebtables_installed] [--noicmpv6_header_match] [--noip6tables_installed] [--noip_nonlocal_bind] [--noiproute2_vxlan] [--noipset_installed] [--nokeepalived_ipv6_support] [--nonova_notify] [--noovs_conntrack] [--noovs_geneve] [--noovs_patch] [--noovs_vxlan] [--noovsdb_native] [--noread_netns] [--nouse-syslog] [--nova_notify] [--noverbose] [--novf_extended_management] [--novf_management] [--nowatch-log-file] [--ovs_conntrack] [--ovs_geneve] [--ovs_patch] [--ovs_vxlan] [--ovsdb_native] [--read_netns] [--state_path STATE_PATH] [--syslog-log-facility SYSLOG_LOG_FACILITY] [--use-syslog] [--verbose] [--version] [--vf_extended_management] [--vf_management] [--watch-log-file] neutron-sanity-check optional arguments ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--arp_header_match`` Check for ARP header match support ``--arp_responder`` Check for ARP responder support ``--bridge_firewalling`` Check bridge firewalling ``--ip_nonlocal_bind`` Check ip_nonlocal_bind kernel option works with network namespaces. ``--config-dir DIR`` Path to a config directory to pull ``*.conf`` files from. This file set is sorted, so as to provide a predictable parse order if individual options are over-ridden. The set is parsed after the file(s) specified via previous --config-file, arguments hence over-ridden options in the directory take precedence. ``--config-file PATH`` Path to a config file to use. Multiple config files can be specified, with values in later files taking precedence. Dafaults to ``None``. ``--debug, -d`` Print debugging output (set logging level to ``DEBUG`` instead of default ``INFO`` level). ``--dhcp_release6`` Check dhcp_release6 installation ``--dibbler_version`` Check minimal dibbler version ``--dnsmasq_version`` Check minimal dnsmasq version ``--ebtables_installed`` Check ebtables installation ``--icmpv6_header_match`` Check for ICMPv6 header match support ``--ip6tables_installed`` Check ip6tables installation ``--iproute2_vxlan`` Check for iproute2 vxlan support ``--ipset_installed`` Check ipset installation ``--keepalived_ipv6_support`` Check keepalived IPv6 support ``--log-config-append PATH, --log_config PATH`` The name of a logging configuration file. This file is appended to any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation. Note that when logging configuration files are used then all logging configuration is set in the configuration file and other logging configuration options are ignored (for example, ``logging_context_format_string``). ``--log-date-format DATE_FORMAT`` Format string for %(asctime)s in log records. Default: None. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. ``--log-dir LOG_DIR, --logdir LOG_DIR`` (Optional) The base directory used for relative ``log-file`` paths. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. ``--log-file PATH, --logfile PATH`` (Optional) Name of log file to output to. If no default is set, logging will go to stderr as defined by ``use_stderr``. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. ``--noarp_header_match`` The inverse of --arp_header_match ``--noarp_responder`` The inverse of --arp_responder ``--nobridge_firewalling`` The inverse of --bridge_firewalling ``--nodebug`` The inverse of --debug ``--nodhcp_release6`` The inverse of --dhcp_release6 ``--nodibbler_version`` The inverse of --dibbler_version ``--nodnsmasq_version`` The inverse of --dnsmasq_version ``--noebtables_installed`` The inverse of --ebtables_installed ``--noicmpv6_header_match`` The inverse of --icmpv6_header_match ``--noip6tables_installed`` The inverse of --ip6tables_installed ``--noip_nonlocal_bind`` The inverse of --ip_nonlocal_bind ``--noiproute2_vxlan`` The inverse of --iproute2_vxlan ``--noipset_installed`` The inverse of --ipset_installed ``--nokeepalived_ipv6_support`` The inverse of --keepalived_ipv6_support ``--nonova_notify`` The inverse of --nova_notify ``--noovs_conntrack`` The inverse of --ovs_conntrack ``--noovs_geneve`` The inverse of --ovs_geneve ``--noovs_patch`` The inverse of --ovs_patch ``--noovs_vxlan`` The inverse of --ovs_vxlan ``--noovsdb_native`` The inverse of --ovsdb_native ``--noread_netns`` The inverse of --read_netns ``--nouse-syslog`` The inverse of --use-syslog ``--nova_notify`` Check for nova notification support ``--noverbose`` The inverse of --verbose ``--novf_extended_management`` The inverse of --vf_extended_management ``--novf_management`` The inverse of --vf_management ``--nowatch-log-file`` The inverse of --watch-log-file ``--ovs_geneve`` Check for OVS Geneve support ``--ovs_patch`` Check for patch port support ``--ovs_vxlan`` Check for OVS vxlan support ``--ovsdb_native`` Check ovsdb native interface support ``--read_netns`` Check netns permission settings ``--state_path STATE_PATH`` Where to store Neutron state files. This directory must be writable by the agent. ``--syslog-log-facility SYSLOG_LOG_FACILITY`` Syslog facility to receive log lines. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. ``--use-syslog`` Use syslog for logging. Existing syslog format is **DEPRECATED** and will be changed later to honor RFC5424. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. ``--verbose, -v`` If set to ``false``, the logging level will be set to ``WARNING`` instead of the default ``INFO`` level. ``--version`` show program's version number and exit ``--vf_extended_management`` Check for VF extended management support ``--vf_management`` Check for VF management support ``--watch-log-file`` Uses logging handler designed to watch file system. When log file is moved or removed this handler will open a new log file with specified path instantaneously. It makes sense only if ``log_file`` option is specified and Linux platform is used. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set.

commit_message:
Linking Vitrage Install Guide in the Install Guide

This is an attempt to add Vitrage Install Guide to the
RDO part of the Install Guide for Ocata. As I could not follow the
instructions from [1] this change is totally my invention :)
For Pike this is happening automatically after has_install_guide
property added to the project in www/project-data/latest.yaml.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/project-install-guide.html

Change-Id: I067d89324f3f820396b9c7f234e6a35513dedfca
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Suppress oslo-config DeprecationWarning during functional test

During functional tests, the following warning appears:
    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py:2605:
    DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing
    its default value to True and then will be removed completely,
    please fix the invalid String(choices=('file', 'filesystem',
    'http', 'https', 'swift', 'swift+http', 'swift+https',
    'swift+config', 'rbd', 'sheepdog', 'cinder', 'vsphere'))
    value '['file']' for option 'default_store'. in version '4.0'

It is due to override with an array, but it should be a string.

Change-Id: I34e7c37de5793c1f68d0eb3933773a325bd33a44

subject: Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 07:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3724066224adfe2a82f43bfdc255144b402c7236', 'message': 'Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683
'}]
commit_message:
Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/56/465856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: isServer: true,

commit_message:
Adds check for existing yum process during the legacy minor update

Checks for an existing /var/run/yum.pid and exit 1 with an error
message saying why.

Change-Id: I374eeb4164a8007ae67fea2796eac109fffdef97
Closes-Bug: 1704131

commit_message:
Only gather facts when necessary

We only need to gather facts once per host, and only
when it's required. Doing it more often just slows
down the deployment.

Change-Id: Id11654218819a544c2b91c636c00374165b16559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/03/483003/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gather_facts: no gather_facts: no

commit_message:
Remove PY34 and add PY35 environment in tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial [1], where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

[1] Please refer to "Python 3 Status of OpenStack projects": https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
Change-Id: I7992a0c98f190ae6ae2402f41148b7ea48b984dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/25/481625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py27,pep8[testenv:py35]

commit_message:
Add Driver API change in 1.33 to history

API Version 1.33 introduced fields related to storage interface to
Driver API as well as Node API. This patch adds missing description
for Driver API to REST API Version History documentation.

Change-Id: I2fd0709865adc1d02cf3800aa11497d97ab0b14b
Partial-Bug: #1559691

commit_message:
Handle volume API version enablement

This is a start to have tempest handle Cinder API versions
based on what is actually enabled. There are currently a
lot of places in the code the assume v1 and v2 are available,
but those versions may be disabled, especially as we try to
get everyone moved onto the latest (final?) v3 API version.

There are more areas that should be fixed up before we can
actually just work with v3 only, but this is a start to get
there.

Closes-bug: #1703044
Change-Id: Icc2e12f06c3b4899f934f000e191552f4a5cd2a9

commit_message:
Correct the create volume snapshot description and used of quota

Create volume snapshot form should show its own description and
used of quota not volumes.

Change-Id: I5e5b1eb085d7d0c3fe446983128d07f73d113c8c
Closes-Bug: #1682987

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-28 14:41:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/d2dd60d007a2ab35bb4521c0df4cbf7d5bd600ac', 'message': 'Remove VGs when cleaning LVM up in devstack

This patch adds removing of the volume group
before removing the loopback device and
the backing file when performing LVM cleanup
in unstack.sh

Without this commit:

unstack.sh removes logical volumes, removes the
loopback devices and deletes the backing file
but leaves a dangling volume group

  $ ./stack.sh && ./unstack.sh
  $ sudo vgs
  VG                    #PV #LV #SN Attr   VSize  VFree

  $ sudo vgremove stack-volumes-default
  /dev/loop0: lseek 4096 failed: Invalid argument
  vg_remove_mdas stack-volumes-default failed

With this commit:

unstack.sh removes volume groups after removing
all logical volumes but before removing
the loopback device and deleting the backing file

commit_message:
Remove VGs when cleaning LVM up in devstack

This patch adds removing of the volume group
before removing the loopback device and
the backing file when performing LVM cleanup
in unstack.sh

Without this commit:

unstack.sh removes logical volumes, removes the
loopback devices and deletes the backing file
but leaves a dangling volume group

  $ ./stack.sh && ./unstack.sh
  $ sudo vgs
  VG                    #PV #LV #SN Attr   VSize  VFree
  stack-volumes-default   1   0   0 wz--n- 10.01g 10.01g
  $ sudo losetup -a
  $ sudo vgremove stack-volumes-default
  /dev/loop0: lseek 4096 failed: Invalid argument
  vg_remove_mdas stack-volumes-default failed

With this commit:

unstack.sh removes volume groups after removing
all logical volumes but before removing
the loopback device and deleting the backing file

Partial-Bug: 1441236
Change-Id: Id9c06fa50f6cad28764f5a3396f559cac9999649
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/25/478525/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Usage: _clean_lvm_volume_group $vg# _remove_lvm_volume_group removes the volume group # # Usage: _remove_lvm_volume_group $vg function _remove_lvm_volume_group { local vg=$1 # Remove the volume group sudo vgremove -f $vg } _remove_lvm_volume_group $vg

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-cells endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-cells related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore.

After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the plain routes list,
the usage of stevedore for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Iec6e720b4e225251ce06ddfecb316569f9260913

commit_message:
Add 'then' support to green thread pool executor (WIP)

The ability to have a future run some function and
then (depending on succcess or failure) run another
function (and return a future for that result) and
so-on makes for some nice chaining of future execution
so in the executor that we are able to add this ability
add it.

Example that can be used to try this:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/473820/

Change-Id: Ie37a5964c4fa514a211fc4700867e876d9704fc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/futurist refs/changes/62/227062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from futurist import _green green_fs = sum(1 for f in fs if isinstance(f, _green.GreenFuture))
deleted_lines: import futurist green_fs = sum(1 for f in fs if isinstance(f, futurist.GreenFuture))

subject: Support pagination for resource routing list operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-19 04:11:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/5d53127328a24242d58098a0581436d75417063b', 'message': "Support pagination for resource routing list operations

1. What is the problem
The resource routing list operations will retrieve all the items in
the database, which will consume too much memory and take long time
to response when the results are considerably large.

2. What is the solution for the problem
To reduce load on the service, list operations will return a maximum
number of items at a time by pagination. To navigate the collection,
the parameters limit and marker can be set in the URI. For example:

/v1.0/routings?limit=2000&marker=500

The marker parameter is the ID of the last item in the previous list.
The limit parameter sets the page size. These parameters are optional.
If the client requests a limit beyond the maximum limit configured by
the deployment, the server returns the maximum limit number of items.
Pagination and filtering can work together for routing's list operations.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Add pagination feature for resource routing list operations.

Change-Id: I05d1b30f502103d247d8be06c1e52fdcec42b41e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-20 08:50:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/66fd595a0e2936ae88c09c16a2e033a101eb4c38', 'message': "Support pagination for resource routing list operations

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-06-25 09:42:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/e462db83ed8f998b06770ab55fc2ed72b901e515', 'message': "Support pagination for resource routing list operations

1. What is the problem
The resource routing list operations will retrieve all the items in
the database, which will consume too much memory and take long time
to response when the results are considerably large.

2. What is the solution for the problem
To reduce load on the service, list operations will return a maximum
number of items at a time by pagination. To navigate the collection,
the parameters limit and marker can be set in the URI. For example:

/v1.0/routings?limit=2000&marker=500

The marker parameter is the ID of the last item in the previous list.
The limit parameter sets the page size. These parameters are optional.
If the client requests a limit beyond the maximum limit configured by
the deployment, the server returns the maximum limit number of items.
Pagination and filtering can work together for routing's list operations.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Add pagination feature for resource routing list operations.

Change-Id: I05d1b30f502103d247d8be06c1e52fdcec42b41e

"}]
commit_message:
Support pagination for resource routing list operations

1. What is the problem
The resource routing list operations will retrieve all the items in
the database, which will consume too much memory and take long time
to response when the results are considerably large.

2. What is the solution for the problem
To reduce load on the service, list operations will return a maximum
number of items at a time by pagination. To navigate the collection,
the parameters limit and marker can be set in the URI. For example:

/v1.0/routings?limit=2000&marker=500

The marker parameter is the ID of the last item in the previous list.
A marker with an invalid ID returns a badRequest (400) fault.
The limit parameter sets the page size. These parameters are optional.
If the client requests a limit beyond the maximum limit configured by
the deployment, the server returns the maximum limit number of items.
Pagination and filtering can work together with routing's list operations.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Add pagination feature for resource routing list operations.

Change-Id: I05d1b30f502103d247d8be06c1e52fdcec42b41e

'created_at': '2017-06-4 20:12:34', 'top_id': '1269a2da-ca95-47db-a2a9-ba9e546d82ee', 'id': 3, 'bottom_id': 'fd72c010-6e62-4866-b999-6dcb718dd7b4', 'project_id': 'de211ce8-e66b-408b-ac0a-7fd6a6c3a36a', 'resource_type': 'port'}, ] RES_MAP = {'resource_routings': ROUTINGS} class FakeSession(object): class WithWrapper(object): def __enter__(self): pass def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback): pass def __init__(self): self.info = {} def __getattr__(self, field): def dummy_method(*args, **kwargs): pass return dummy_method def __contains__(self, item): return False @property def is_active(self): return True def begin(self, subtransactions=False, nested=True): return FakeSession.WithWrapper() def begin_nested(self): return FakeSession.WithWrapper() def query(self, model): if isinstance(model, attributes.InstrumentedAttribute): model = model.class_ if model.__tablename__ not in RES_MAP: return FakeQuery([], model.__tablename__) return FakeQuery(RES_MAP[model.__tablename__], model.__tablename__) class FakeQuery(object): def __init__(self, records, table): self.records = records self.table = table self.index = 0 def _handle_pagination_by_id(self, record_id): for i, record in enumerate(self.records): if record['id'] == record_id: if i + 1 < len(self.records): return FakeQuery(self.records[i + 1:], self.table) else: return FakeQuery([], self.table) return FakeQuery([], self.table) def _handle_filter(self, keys, values): filtered_list = [] for record in self.records: selected = True for i, key in enumerate(keys): if key not in record or record[key] != values[i]: selected = False break if selected: filtered_list.append(record) return FakeQuery(filtered_list, self.table) def filter(self, *criteria): _filter = [] keys = [] values = [] for e in criteria: if not hasattr(e, 'right') and isinstance(e, elements.False_): # filter is a single False value, set key to a 'INVALID_FIELD' # then no records will be returned keys.append('INVALID_FIELD') values.append(False) elif hasattr(e, 'right') and not isinstance(e.right, elements.Null): _filter.append(e) if not _filter: if not keys: return FakeQuery(self.records, self.table) else: return self._handle_filter(keys, values) if hasattr(_filter[0].right, 'value'): keys.extend([e.left.name for e in _filter]) values.extend([e.right.value for e in _filter]) else: keys.extend([e.expression.left.name for e in _filter]) values.extend( [e.expression.right.element.clauses[0].value for e in _filter]) if _filter[0].expression.operator.__name__ == 'gt': return self._handle_pagination_by_id(values[0]) else: return self._handle_filter(keys, values) def order_by(self, func): self.records.sort(key=lambda x: x['id']) return FakeQuery(self.records, self.table) def limit(self, limit): return FakeQuery(self.records[:limit], self.table) def next(self): if self.index >= len(self.records): raise StopIteration self.index += 1 return self.records[self.index - 1] __next__ = next def __iter__(self): return self class FakeContext(context.Context): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(FakeContext, self).__init__(**kwargs) self._session = None self.is_admin = True @property def session(self): if not self._session: self._session = FakeSession() return self._session def elevated(self): return self def fake_get_context(): return FakeContext() @patch.object(context, 'extract_context_from_environ', new=fake_get_context) def test_get_routings_with_pagination(self): # no pagination and filters are applied to the routings, so all of the # routings will be retrieved. routings = self.controller.get_all() ids = [routing['id'] for key, values in six.iteritems(routings) for routing in values] self.assertEqual([1, 2, 3, 4], ids) # test cases when filters are used. SUPPORTED_FILTERS = ['id', 'top_id', 'bottom_id', 'pod_id', 'project_id', 'resource_type', 'created_at', 'updated_at'] for filter_name in SUPPORTED_FILTERS: filters = {filter_name: ROUTINGS[0][filter_name]} routings = self.controller.get_all(**filters) items = [routing[filter_name] for key, values in six.iteritems(routings) for routing in values] self.assertEqual(1, len(items)) # pagination limit = 1 routings1 = self.controller.get_all(limit=1) routings2 = self.controller.get_all( limit=1, marker=routings1['resource_routings'][0]['id']) routings3 = self.controller.get_all( limit=1, marker=routings2['resource_routings'][0]['id']) routings4 = self.controller.get_all( limit=1, marker=routings3['resource_routings'][0]['id']) routings = [] for routing in (routings1, routings2, routings3, routings4): routings.extend(routing['resource_routings']) self.assertEqual(ROUTINGS, routings) # pagination limit = 2 routings1 = self.controller.get_all(limit=2) routings2 = self.controller.get_all( limit=2, marker=routings1['resource_routings'][1]['id']) routings = [] for routing in (routings1, routings2): routings.extend(routing['resource_routings']) self.assertEqual(ROUTINGS, routings) # test cases when pagination and filters are used routings = self.controller.get_all(resource_type='port', limit=2) self.assertEqual(2, len(routings['resource_routings'])) routings = self.controller.get_all(resource_type='subnet', limit=2) self.assertEqual(1, len(routings['resource_routings'])) # test return value has next page link routings = self.controller.get_all(limit=2) self.assertIn('resource_routings_link', routings) # apply a filter and if it doesn't match with any of the retrieved # routings, then all of them will be discarded and the method returns # with []. Also, if limit is not specified, then no next page link in # response info kw_filter2 = {'resource_type': 'port2'} routings = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter2) self.assertEqual([], routings['resource_routings']) self.assertNotIn('resource_routings_link', routings) # test cases when limit or marker is abnormal routings = self.controller.get_all(limit=0) self.assertEqual(len(ROUTINGS), len(routings['resource_routings'])) res = self.controller.get_all(limit=-1) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) res = self.controller.get_all(limit='20x') self._validate_error_code(res, 400) res = self.controller.get_all(limit=2, marker=-1) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) res = self.controller.get_all(limit=2, marker="last") self._validate_error_code(res, 400) res = self.controller.get_all(limit=2, marker=0) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) # failure case, use an unsupported filter type kw_filter3 = {'resource': 'port'} res = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter3) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) kw_filter4 = {'pod_id': "pod_id_1", 'resource': 'port'} res = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter4) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) @patch.object(pecan, 'response', new=FakeResponse) def test_get_all_non_admin(self, mock_context):
deleted_lines: def test_get_all(self, mock_context): # prepare the foreign key: pod_id kw_pod2 = {'pod': {'region_name': 'pod2', 'az_name': 'az1'}} pod_id2 = pod.PodsController().post(**kw_pod2)['pod']['pod_id'] kw_routing2 = {'routing': {'top_id': 'b669a2da-ca95-47db-a2a9-ba9e546d82ee', 'bottom_id': 'fd72c010-6e62-4866-b999-6dcb718dd7b4', 'pod_id': pod_id2, 'project_id': project_id, 'resource_type': 'port' }} self.controller.post(**kw_routing2) # no filters are applied to the routings, so all of the routings will # be retrieved. routings = self.controller.get_all() actual = [(routing['top_id'], routing['pod_id']) for routing in routings['routings']] expect = [('c7f641c9-8462-4007-84b2-3035d8cfb7a3', pod_id1), ('b669a2da-ca95-47db-a2a9-ba9e546d82ee', pod_id2)] six.assertCountEqual(self, expect, actual) # apply a resource type filter to the retrieved routings. kw_filter1 = {'resource_type': 'port'} routings = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter1) actual = [(routing['top_id'], routing['pod_id'], routing['resource_type']) for routing in routings['routings']] expect = [('b669a2da-ca95-47db-a2a9-ba9e546d82ee', pod_id2, 'port')] six.assertCountEqual(self, expect, actual) # apply a filter and if it doesn't match with any of the retrieved # routings, then all of them will be discarded and the method returns # with [] kw_filter2 = {'resource_type': 'port2'} routings = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter2) self.assertEqual([], routings['routings']) # failure case, use an unsupported filter type kw_filter3 = {'resource': 'port'} res = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter3) self._validate_error_code(res, 400) kw_filter4 = {'pod_id': pod_id1, 'resource': 'port'} res = self.controller.get_all(**kw_filter4) self._validate_error_code(res, 400)

commit_message:
Add the upper constraints to package versions

Currently tox does not have any upper constraints, due to which there is a
possibility of tox to use a newer version of dependent library that may not
be supported yet. This patch add the upper constrainsts as set by the
openstack/requirements repository

Change-Id: I89ab7199844541526166f77724d95c60713ccca7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/60/349660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(from nova tox.ini by jaegerandi): This target does not use constraints # because upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Add a locale param to allow vSphere SDK locale specification.

Because oslo.vmware driver does not allow locale specification
when creating a SDK api session, the api session will use the
default locale settings of the Managed-to vCenter.

In this case, if vCenter's locale is Chinese, the vCenter
will throw out error messages in Chinese of Unicode if some nova
actions fail, something like following in nova-compute.log:

VMwareDriverException: \u65e0\u6548\u7684\u6570\u636e\u5b58\u50a8
\u8def\u5f84\u201c[datastore_132] vmware_temp/a5635643-331f-4e45-
b5fc-be064c0f7cf6/a62bbf4a-66ea-4426-ab29-ec5299bd1633\u201d\u3002

This message is unreadable for a human being, and the logs are
mixed by English and Chinese.

To avoid such circumstances, we had better enable oslo.vmware to
allow locale specification so that we could use prefered locale.

Closes-bug: #1456118
Change-Id: I8330c6c07c6e959e7af627d777c6e3e171120372

It's a two-character ISO-639 language ID (like "en") optionally followed by an underscore and a two-character ISO 3166 country ID (like "US"). Examples are "de", "fr_CA", "zh", "zh_CN", "zh_TW" and so on. Note: The method uses the server default locale when a locale is not provided. This default can be configured in the server configuration file. If unspecified, it defaults to the locale of the server environment or English ("en") if unsupported. self._locale = locale password=self._server_password, locale=self._locale)

commit_message:
Add API for introspecting OVAs
repair commend issue
This change adds ova.py and test_ova.py (corresponding unit tests)
to oslo/vmware and tests/ respectively.
ova.py has a class API which has the following method introspecting
OVAs that contains OVF and root VMDK:

	*get_ovf_and_root_vmdk

Change-Id: I94c304223eabcaec73e93bf0f59c4f2ea0f2e8e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/08/105208/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 VMware, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import contextlib import io import tarfile import urllib2 TAR_BLOCK_SIZE = tarfile.BLOCKSIZE # 512 bytes class API(object): def get_ovf_and_root_vmdk(self, ova): """Return OVF and root VMDK files Currently, we assume that path and format of OVA file is valid e.g) no missing fields :param ova: file path of OVA file """ def offset_to_next_file(file_size): """Return the number of bytes to the next file in a tar archive Each file in a tar archive is splitted into block-size blocks, and each of them is followed by binary zeros at the end to fill the rest of the block. If file size is the multiple of block size, there is a block-size block filled with binary zeros at the end of the file. If so, thus the return value is the block size not 0. :param file_size: file size in bytes """ offset = file_size % TAR_BLOCK_SIZE if offset != 0: offset = TAR_BLOCK_SIZE - (file_size % TAR_BLOCK_SIZE) return offset chunk_size = TAR_BLOCK_SIZE * 2 * 2048 # 2 Mib if block size is 512 B ret_data = {'ovf': None, 'vmdk': None} with contextlib.closing(urllib2.urlopen(ova)) as ova_file: found_ovf = False found_root_vmdk = False while not (found_ovf and found_root_vmdk): # We keep reading OVA until we find both OVF and VMDK # assuming that the first VMDK file found is the root. # We need to do this as a tar archive is not indexed. # chunksize is passed to read(...) so that the following # operations do not block instead of waitng until a whole OVA # is downloaded. Also, chuncksize might not be really big, # , e.g. 2^31 bytes, # runtime error could occur otherwise.(as socket.py might not # be able to handle it each time read(...) is called) # # TODO(massa): fix me to avoid possible errors header = ova_file.read(TAR_BLOCK_SIZE) info = tarfile.TarInfo.frombuf(header) file_size = info.size file_format = info.name.split('.')[-1] if file_format in ('ovf', 'vmdk'): file_obj = io.BytesIO() while file_size > chunk_size: buf = ova_file.read(chunk_size) file_obj.write(buf) file_size -= chunk_size buf = ova_file.read(file_size) file_obj.write(buf) ret_data[file_format] = file_obj.getvalue() if file_format == 'ovf': found_ovf = True if file_format == 'vmdk': found_root_vmdk = True else: while file_size > chunk_size: ova_file.read(chunk_size) file_size -= chunk_size ova_file.read(file_size) offset = offset_to_next_file(file_size) ova_file.read(offset) return ret_data

Make use of SO_REUSEPORT option to improve server's concurrency capability

Implements blueprint make-use-of-socket-soreuseport-option

Change-Id: I2dff03590a5d5ed111146f49aaaf4ee71f17572b

subject: Decode special chars in vSphere objects' propset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-02 05:39:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/e92865c92c5eb10cbe535ee4b631539ae45bdaf3', 'message': 'Decode special character in vSphere objects' propset.

For example, if the name of cluster in vCenter has special character like "/",
vSphere api call will return the name as "cluster%2f01", which is encoded as
a url pattern, so that openstack nova vmware driver will fail to match this
cluster by name "cluster/01".

This change will decode the special encoded characters into original values,
so that nova vmware driver will support name like "cluster/01" defined
in vCetner.

Change-Id: I478cc07e5f6a3bbaa3c13efbeb1cf0a8e0155422

commit_message:
Decode special chars in vSphere objects' propset

For example, if the name of cluster in vCenter has special character like "/",
vSphere api call will return the name as "cluster%2f01", which is encoded as
a url pattern, so that openstack nova vmware driver will fail to match this
cluster by name "cluster/01".

This change will decode the special encoded characters into original values,
so that nova vmware driver will support name like "cluster/01" defined
in vCenter.

Change-Id: I478cc07e5f6a3bbaa3c13efbeb1cf0a8e0155422
Closes-Bug:#1412696

commit_message:
Add UUID Validation

This change adds a flag for enabling UUID validation
on the UUIDField Type.

It currently defaults to False, to allow Nova and other project to
continue with the current behaviour, but allow other projects to use
it.

There is a follow on patch that depricates the validate=False
and will force projects that cannot use this feature to explictily set
this to False.

There can then be an additional deprication cycle for that kwarg,
to make it always validate.

Change-Id: I738a27af41d0e0cb06e7aef65fccc55b1e46b687

commit_message:
Compound Field validation (WiP)

Work In Progress, need to add support for Dicts and Sets.
+ Tests

Change-Id: I7e5b084da6ec07c6c84537fabd4bf333a4d072d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/19/196819/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CompoundFieldType(ValidatableType): PROXIED_METHODS = [] def __init__(self, element_type, validators=None, **field_args): validators = validators or None super(CompoundFieldType, self).__init__(validators) def build_collection_proxy(self, collection_type, element_type, obj, field, items): """Builds a validation proxy for collection of object Dynamically subclasses a given collection class (list, dict or set), wrapping all the methods which may modify it into validating functions. Each of these functions creates a copy of existing collection, applies the given modification (append, insert, __setitem__ etc) to it, then validates the result against all the present validators, and then (if no error occurred) applies the modification to initial collection. """ proxy_type_name = '%s_validationProxy' % collection_type.__name__ def wrap_mutating_method(method): def wrapper(collection, *args, **kwargs): # NOTE(ativelkov): # We need to make a copy of collection, apply the modification # and validate it. However, executing a copy.copy() will create # a copy of proxy. As we don't want to run any recursive # validations while that copy is created, we need to create an # instance of unproxied collection class instead. collection_copy = collection_type(element_type, obj, field, collection) copy_method = getattr(collection_copy, method.__name__, None) if copy_method is not None: copy_method(*args, **kwargs) self.validate(obj, field, collection_copy) if obj is not None and hasattr(obj, 'notify_field_changing'): obj.obj_notify_field_changing(field, collection_copy) return method(collection, *args, **kwargs) return wrapper methods = {} for method_name in self.PROXIED_METHODS: method = getattr(collection_type, method_name, None) if method is not None: methods[method_name] = wrap_mutating_method(method) collection_proxy_type = type(proxy_type_name, (collection_type,), methods) return collection_proxy_type(element_type, obj, field, items) PROXIED_METHODS = ['append', 'extend', 'insert', 'pop', 'remove', 'reverse', 'sort', '__setitem__', '__delitem__', '__delslice__', '__setslice__', '__iadd__'] return self.build_collection_proxy(CoercedList, self._element_type, obj, attr, value) # return CoercedList(self._element_type, obj=obj, field=attr, # iterable=value)
deleted_lines: class CompoundFieldType(FieldType): def __init__(self, element_type, **field_args): return CoercedList(self._element_type, obj=obj, field=attr, iterable=value)

subject: Adds value validation to the fields
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 13:07:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/commit/49e388c801fa7564d0a0fb4901a90905c11645ee', 'message': 'Adds value validation to the fields

This introduce a concept of validation, which allows to check the values
of objects' fields when they are assigned.

A new FiledType subclass called ValidatableType is introduced. It adds
a list of validators (functions of appropariate signature) and a
'validate' method which iterates over the list of validators and checks
if the given value satifies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which aacepts object, attribute name and a
value as paramters. It should either return a boolen ('True' stands for
a valid value, 'False - for invalid), or a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object if that object is an instance of ValidatableObject.

A developer may addany custom validators to any field (by passing a list
of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern
 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequalit for
     maximum check
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value
 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check
 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type a
'ValidatableAutoTypedField' class is added. It it similar to old
'AutoTypedField' but defines its field type not an an instance, but as a
class, which gets instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type
may be parametrized with appropriate constraints.
Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField) are
inherited from this new type, while the old AutoTypedField is left
intact for backwards compatibility.
DateTime field alias is also modified, but is inherited from a refular
field as it has a different initializer spec (uses extra field type
paramter)

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-03 12:41:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/commit/4eed6216a5f595fbd3172f233c43e738e0680703', 'message': 'Adds value validation to the fields

This introduce a concept of validation, which allows to check the values
of objects' fields when they are assigned.

FieldType class has got a new attribute '_validators', which is a list
of validators (functions of appropriate signature) and a 'validate'
method which iterates over the list of validators and checks
if the given value satisfies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which accepts an object, an attribute name and
a value as paramters. It should return a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object.

A developer may add any custom validators to any field (by passing a
list of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern

 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequalit for
     maximum check
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value

 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check

 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type
the 'AutoTypedField' class is improved. It addition to existing
'AUTO_TYPE' attribute a new one - called 'AUTO_TYPE_CLASS' - is added.
It defines the field type not as an instance, but as a class, which gets
instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type may be
parameterized with appropriate constraints.

Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField,
DateTimeField) are modified to use this new functionality.

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148

if the given value satisfies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which accepts an object, an attribute name and
a value as paramters. It should return a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object.

A developer may add any custom validators to any field (by passing a
list of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern

 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequalit for
     maximum check
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value

 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check

 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - exclusive_minimum - a boolean flag to enforce strict unequality for
     the minimum check
   - exclusive_maximum - a boolean flag to enforce string unequality for
     the maximum check

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type
the 'AutoTypedField' class is improved. It addition to existing
'AUTO_TYPE' attribute a new one - called 'AUTO_TYPE_CLASS' - is added.
It defines the field type not as an instance, but as a class, which gets
instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type may be
parameterized with appropriate constraints.

Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField,
DateTimeField) are modified to use this new functionality.

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148

commit_message:
Adds value validation to the fields

This introduce a concept of validation, which allows to check the values
of objects' fields when they are assigned.

FieldType class has got a new attribute '_validators', which is a list
of validators (functions of appropriate signature) and a 'validate'
method which iterates over the list of validators and checks
if the given value satisfies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which accepts an object, an attribute name and
a value as paramters. It should return a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object.

A developer may add any custom validators to any field (by passing a
list of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern

 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value

 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type
the 'AutoTypedField' class is improved. It addition to existing
'AUTO_TYPE' attribute a new one - called 'AUTO_TYPE_CLASS' - is added.
It defines the field type not as an instance, but as a class, which gets
instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type may be
parameterized with appropriate constraints.

Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField,
DateTimeField) are modified to use this new functionality.

Depends-on: Ie20377e86134a5e8b68a93a08c26ed6f3025ae9d
(The dependency is needed, as otherwise nova's unit tests will be
broken: the change of enums to coerce their 'valid_values' modifies
the string representation of unicode fields)

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/41/196041/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import reclass ValidatableType(FieldType): def __init__(self, validators=None, *args, **kwargs): self._validators = validators or [] super(ValidatableType, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def validate(self, obj, attr, value): errors = [] generic_validation_error = False for validator in self._validators: result = validator(obj, attr, value) error = None if isinstance(result, tuple) and len(result) == 2: error = result[1] result = result[0] if result is True or result is None: continue else: if error is not None: errors.append(error) else: generic_validation_error = True if generic_validation_error: errors.append(_("validation error")) if errors: raise exception.InvalidFieldValue(fieldname=attr, reason=','.join(errors)) value = self._type.coerce(obj, attr, value) if isinstance(self._type, ValidatableType): self._type.validate(obj, attr, value) return valueclass String(ValidatableType): def __init__(self, min_length=None, max_length=None, pattern=None, validators=None, *args, **kwargs): self.min_length = min_length self.max_length = max_length self.pattern = pattern if pattern is not None: self._compiled_pattern = re.compile(pattern) validators = validators or [] validators.extend([self._min_length, self._max_length, self._pattern]) super(String, self).__init__(validators, *args, **kwargs) def _min_length(self, obj, field, value): if self.min_length is not None: return len(value) >= self.min_length, _("string is too short") def _max_length(self, obj, field, value): if self.max_length is not None: return len(value) <= self.max_length, _("string is too long") def _pattern(self, obj, field, value): if self.pattern: return self._compiled_pattern.match(value) is not None, \ _("string does not match pattern") class MinMaxValidatable(ValidatableType): """Base class for validatable fields which should have min/max checks""" def __init__(self, minimum=None, maximum=None, exclusive_minimum=False, exclusive_maximum=False, validators=None, *args, **kwargs): # NOTE(ativelkov): coercing the min/max constraints themselves if minimum is not None: minimum = self.coerce(None, "minimum", minimum) if maximum is not None: maximum = self.coerce(None, "maximum", maximum) self.minimum = minimum self.maximum = maximum self.exclusive_minimum = exclusive_minimum self.exclusive_maximum = exclusive_maximum validators = validators or [] validators.extend([self._min_value, self._max_value]) super(MinMaxValidatable, self).__init__(validators, *args, **kwargs) def _min_value(self, obj, attr, value): if self.minimum is not None: msg = _("value is less than minimum") if self.exclusive_minimum: return value > self.minimum, msg else: return value >= self.minimum, msg def _max_value(self, obj, attr, value): if self.maximum is not None: msg = _("value is greater than maximum") if self.exclusive_maximum: return value < self.maximum, msg else: return value <= self.maximum, msg class Integer(MinMaxValidatable): def __init__(self, multiple_of=None, validators=None, *args, **kwargs): if multiple_of is not None: multiple_of = self.coerce(None, "multiple_of", multiple_of) self.multiple_of = multiple_of validators = validators or [] validators.append(self._multiple_of) super(Integer, self).__init__(validators=validators, *args, **kwargs) def _multiple_of(self, obj, attr, value): if self.multiple_of is not None: return (value % self.multiple_of == 0, _("value is not a multiple of %i") % self.multiple_of) class Float(MinMaxValidatable):class DateTime(MinMaxValidatable):class ValidatableAutoTypedField(Field): """Base-class for validatable auto-typed fields Similar to AutoTypedField, but defines field types as a class, so its instances are parametrized when the field is instantiated """ AUTO_TYPE_CLASS = None def __init__(self, nullable=False, default=UnspecifiedDefault, read_only=False, **kwargs): if self.AUTO_TYPE_CLASS is None: raise exception.FieldTypeUnset(fieldname=self.__class__.__name__) if not issubclass(self.AUTO_TYPE_CLASS, ValidatableType): raise exception.ValidatableFieldInvalid( typename=self.AUTO_TYPE_CLASS.__name__, fieldname=self.__class__.__name__) field_type = self.AUTO_TYPE_CLASS(**kwargs) super(ValidatableAutoTypedField, self).__init__(field_type, nullable, default, read_only) class StringField(ValidatableAutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE_CLASS = String typename=self.AUTO_TYPE.__class__.__name__,class IntegerField(ValidatableAutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE_CLASS = Integer class FloatField(ValidatableAutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE_CLASS = Floatclass DateTimeField(Field): def __init__(self, tzinfo_aware=True, nullable=False, default=UnspecifiedDefault, read_only=False, **kwargs): super(DateTimeField, self).__init__(DateTime(tzinfo_aware, **kwargs), nullable, default, read_only)
deleted_lines: return self._type.coerce(obj, attr, value)class String(FieldType):class Integer(FieldType):class Float(FieldType):class DateTime(FieldType):class StringField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = String() typename=self.AUTO_TYPE.__class__.__name,class IntegerField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = Integer() class FloatField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = Float()class DateTimeField(AutoTypedField): def __init__(self, tzinfo_aware=True, **kwargs): self.AUTO_TYPE = DateTime(tzinfo_aware=tzinfo_aware) super(DateTimeField, self).__init__(**kwargs)
