'}]
commit_message:
templates: aodh-httpd: Ensure proper user control in aodh root

We need to ensure that /var/www/cgi-bin/ has proper user control since
different distributions place cgi-bin in different directories and as
such the default ones may not apply for aodh. For example, openSUSE
places it in /srv/www/cgi-bin and as such accessing the aodh resources
results to 403 HTTP errors.

Change-Id: Ia3889d0e4e0220b481fa94c8b0b151b6d727e1b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_aodh refs/changes/33/482333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <Directory "/var/www/cgi-bin"> AllowOverride None Options +ExecCGI -Includes <IfModule !mod_access_compat.c> Require all granted </IfModule> <IfModule mod_access_compat.c> Order allow,deny Allow from all </IfModule> </Directory>

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Additionally,
for openSUSE, we need to load some extra apache2 modules which are
not there by default. Finally, Apache on openSUSE configures some
of it's components in httpd.conf and some others in default-server.conf
so it's not possible to drop one of them as that will likely break
Apache. A future improvement would be to drop both and provide a good
httpd.conf template. Until then, we need to drop the default
configuration for the root directory as that breaks Horizon since
it does not allow symlinks and global access to it.

Change-Id: I51613df836c6a507f6f36967c0ce4b76ba9202a9

commit_message:
tasks: horizon_apache: Use the apache2_module Ansible module

The upstream bug https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5328
has been fixed so remove the workaround and use the Ansible module
directly. Moreover, we also need to set 'ignore_configcheck: yes' to
ignore the apachectl warnings whe disabling the mpm_* modules.

Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5328
Change-Id: I20bd0cf6148794c7a6342c3f7eda444cbb715e06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/23/482923/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(hwoarang): Module enable/disable process is only functional on Debian # and SUSE based systems. apache2_module: name: "{{ item.name }}" state: "{{ item.state }}"
deleted_lines: # Workaround for https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5328 # TODO: Replace using apache2_module when fixed in Ansible release command: "{{ (item.state == 'present') | ternary('a2enmod','a2dismod') }} {{ item.name }}" register: horizon_apache2_module changed_when: horizon_apache2_module.stdout.find('{{ item.name }} already') == -1

subject: gnocchi: fix alarms for unpriviledged user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-12 12:24:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/22c1a9e4d3decb2b990607f285ad62a6cf1379a1', 'message': 'gnocchi: fix alarms for unpriviledged user

When an unprivileged user want to access to Gnocchi resources
created by Ceilometer, that doesn't work because the filter scope
the Gnocchi query to resource owner to the user. To fix we introduce
a new configuration option "gnocchi_external_project_owner" set by
default to "service". The new filter now allow two kind of Gnocchi
resources:
* owned by the user project
* owned by "gnocchi_external_project_owner" and the orignal project_id
  of the resource is the user project.

Closes-bug: #1703824

commit_message:
gnocchi: fix alarms for unpriviledged user

When an unprivileged user want to access to Gnocchi resources
created by Ceilometer, that doesn't work because the filter scope
the Gnocchi query to resource owner to the user. To fix we introduce
a new configuration option "gnocchi_external_project_owner" set by
default to "service". The new filter now allow two kind of Gnocchi
resources:
* owned by the user project
* owned by "gnocchi_external_project_owner" and the orignal project_id
  of the resource is the user project.

Closes-bug: #1703824
Change-Id: I0c86736a902a21520da18550aea0a7d1549bb24e
(cherry picked from commit b0bdd43209a47181a8124e28990127620cba03a7)

commit_message:
tasks: galera_install_zypper: Drop zypper workaround for Ansible < 2.2

openstack-ansible is using Ansible >= 2.3 so we can safely drop the <2.2
workaround for zypper and import the repository keys directly using the
auto_import_keys option.

Change-Id: I03e1e05cd1299abf9eb909d3b414fe7ecd26636c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/38/482638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auto_import_keys: yes
deleted_lines: # NOTE(hwoarang): zypper_repository/auto_import_keys added in 2.2 # so we need to manually refresh the repository and import the keys # in order to work with older ansible versions.# NOTE(hwoarang): We need to run this right after we add the repos and # before we install any packages so it can't be a handler unless we # move everything to pre_tasks - name: Refresh galera zypper repository command: zypper --gpg-auto-import-keys ref when: zypper_repository_added.changed tags: - skip_ansible_lint - galera-repos

subject: templates: gnocchi-httpd: Ensure proper user control in gnocchi root
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-11 16:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['templates/gnocchi-httpd.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi/commit/68343520de98117bb007af4b265967aeaf625e47', 'message': 'templates: gnocchi-httpd: Ensure proper user control in gnocchi root

We need to ensure that /var/www/cgi-bin/ has proper user control since
different distributions place cgi-bin in different directories and as
such the default ones may not apply for aodh. For example, openSUSE
places it in /srv/www/cgi-bin and as such accessing the gnocchi
resources results to 403 HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I146190d56f2d68b84b52cc0c349add321fdf08cc
'}]
commit_message:
templates: gnocchi-httpd: Ensure proper user control in gnocchi root

We need to ensure that /var/www/cgi-bin/ has proper user control since
different distributions place cgi-bin in different directories and as
such the default ones may not apply for aodh. For example, openSUSE
places it in /srv/www/cgi-bin and as such accessing the gnocchi
resources results to 403 HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I146190d56f2d68b84b52cc0c349add321fdf08cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi refs/changes/32/482632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <Directory "/var/www/cgi-bin"> AllowOverride None Options +ExecCGI -Includes <IfModule !mod_access_compat.c> Require all granted </IfModule> <IfModule mod_access_compat.c> Order allow,deny Allow from all </IfModule> </Directory>

commit_message:
When using ceph storage in nova, the libvirt driver should not
cleanup the root disk except booting scenario such as evacuating
instance failed. If the root disk is removed, maybe some user
datas in it lost.

commit_message:
Verify that check_app_loaded is called with correct app name

DF applications were renamed. However, invocations of check_app_loaded
still use the old app names, and therefore tests are skipped. This
change fixes that.

Change-Id: Ib907e6cf1f54d802da59982d96e12ae9ef996c91

[WIP] Handle boot_index in block_device_info also for volumes

it is possible to specify a boot_index in the block device
mapping for volumes but the information was not passed down
to libvirt.

commit_message:
tasks: galera_client_install_zypper: Drop zypper workaround for Ansible < 2.2

openstack-ansible is using Ansible >= 2.3 so we can safely drop the <2.2
workaround for zypper and import the repository keys directly using the
auto_import_keys option.

Change-Id: Ic839829df9f96b3145f8a5d7c77f0f7b04fba12e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/39/482639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auto_import_keys: yes
deleted_lines: # NOTE(hwoarang): zypper_repository/auto_import_keys added in 2.2 # so we need to manually refresh the repository and import the keys # in order to work with older ansible versions. # NOTE(hwoarang): We need to run this right after we add the repos and # before we install any packages so it can't be a handler unless we # move everything to pre_tasks - name: Refresh galera client zypper repository command: zypper --gpg-auto-import-keys ref when: zypper_repository_added.changed tags: - skip_ansible_lint - galera-repos

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-12 20:53:59.000000000', 'files': ['zunclient/v1/containers_shell.py', 'zunclient/osc/v1/containers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient/commit/cc22f693098cf6ae0dd83a4c2de2a13c2166cadc', 'message': "Rename parameter '--nets' to '--net'

The parameter '--nets' is used to specify a neutron network the
container will connect to. It can be used multiple times if
the container is going to connect to multiple networks.
The plural name (nets) is confusing when it is used multiple times.
It is better to change it to singular name (net). The command
will look like this:

$ zun run --net network=<net1> --net network=<net2> ...

Change-Id: I1689617326e530bff60d3530020ccf9e57092938
Closes-Bug: #1703985
"}]
commit_message:
Rename parameter '--nets' to '--net'

The parameter '--nets' is used to specify a neutron network the
container will connect to. It can be used multiple times if
the container is going to connect to multiple networks.
The plural name (nets) is confusing when it is used multiple times.
It is better to change it to singular name (net). The command
will look like this:

$ zun run --net network=<net1> --net network=<net2> ...

Change-Id: I1689617326e530bff60d3530020ccf9e57092938
Closes-Bug: #1703985

Support different resource types in collectd

Currently, due to a bug, collectd alarms are supported only on hosts. I fixed the bug + added tests

commit_message:
Specification - OSH-logging-framework

This outlines the foundation for a centralized logging platform
for OpenStack-Helm. The foundation includes charts for fluentd,
elasticsearch, and kibana to provide visualization on indices
created on events logged to stdout/stderr from the openstack and
infrastructure services and collected via fluentd.

The goal is to gain feedback and consensus on the path forward
for these services

Change-Id: I321537b80b1b24b795722a88731c1ecbf6bf77e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/77/482677/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ===================== osh-logging-framework ===================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-helm/+spec/osh-logging-framework Problem description =================== OpenStack-Helm currently lacks a centralized logging mechanism for ingesting, storing, and displaying analysis on events logged by both the OpenStack services and the various infrastructure components OpenStack-Helm relies on to function. This makes it difficult to identify operational issues with the platform in a timely and unified manner. Proposed change =============== Utilize fluentd, Elasticsearch, and Kibana to consume, index, and visualize the events logged by the OpenStack services and the infrastructure components of OpenStack-Helm. Fluentd allows for the capture of these events logged to stdout and stderr, applies additional metadata to the events, indexes the data into Elasticsearch, and Kibana provides visualization on the data indexed in Elasticsearch. This proposed change is representative of the approach used by other applications running in Kubernetes. Security impact --------------- Elasticsearch does not provide authentication out of the box without a paid license for Shield or Xpack. There are free Elasticsearch plugins that provide basic authentication functionality, but would require additional work to enable them. Lack of authentication or the limiting of access to Elasticsearch does provide visbility into sensitive information, and it could expose the Elasticsearch cluster to tampering and other malicious behavior. Performance Impact ------------------ OpenStack-Helm's overall performance should not be impacted. The currently supported services already log to stdout and stderr, and Elasticsearch will be responsible for storing and indexing the data consumed. Some performance issues have been reported when Elasticsearch has PVCs backed by Ceph, so profiling the performance with Ceph-backed PVCs should be considered. Alternatives ------------ The primary alternatives would be Logstash in place of fluentd, other timeseries databases, or Monasca in the OpenStack namespace. The proposed approach is preferred due to fluentd's flexibility in consuming logs from multiple sources with varying formats, the ability to tag certain logged events with additional metadata, and the wide range of plugins available from the fluentd community. Elasticsearch provides a highly available storage cluster for storing events, which allows for quick indexing and searching of the information provided by the targeted services. Elasticsearch also offers a flexible logging mechanism for log rotation and handling. Kibana offers a clean visualization platform that integrates with Elasticsearch. Other visualization tools like Grafana could be used as alternatives, but the native integration between Elasticsearch and Kibana makes it a good fit. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: srwilker Work Items ---------- The following charts are required and should align with the design choices present in Openstack-Helm 1. Fluentd 2. Elasticsearch 3. Kibana Sensible default configuration values need to also be identified for the charts listed above. 1. Fluentd inputs and filters broken out appropriately 2. Elasticsearch configured in a stateful, highly available manner 3. Implement alternatives for Elasticsearch authentication shortcomings 4. Appropriate Kibana defaults identified Testing ======= Testing should be achieved through Helm tests included in the charts. These should inclide: 1. Fluentd configuration valid 2. Fluentd queries Elasticsearch to verify data indexed appropriately 3. Elasticsearch can insert, index, and retrieve supplied data appropriately Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation needs to outline the components of the logging framework and how the OpenStack-Helm services are configured to supply the logging platform with any output required to function. The default values for these services should also target appropriate defaults for getting meaningful information from the logging platform. References ========== 1. Fluentd_ 2. Elasticsearch_ 3. Kibana_ .. _Fluentd: http://www.fluentd.org/ .. _Elasticsearch: https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch .. _Kibana: https://github.com/elastic/kibana

subject: Improve openstack-release file discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-11 15:48:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/04f6460c25011bed163af7e523a89f664eca03d0', 'message': 'Improve openstack-release file discovery

In cases where the deployment node is seperated from the infrastructure
node, the openstack-release file discovery logic might calculate the
wrong release since the /etc/openstack-release file does not get generated
on the deployment node.
This commit adds logic to pull down the /etc/openstack-release file from
the infrastucture node to the deployment node. This way, the release discovery
logic will properly assess the openstack release even in situations where the
deployment node is isolated from the infra node.

Change-Id: I6136609ef11be7b98ddcfc7589dd17cf1e98c362

commit_message:
Improve openstack-release file discovery

In cases where the deployment node is seperated from the infrastructure
node, the openstack-release file discovery logic might calculate the
wrong release since the /etc/openstack-release file does not get generated
on the deployment node.
This commit adds logic to pull down the /etc/openstack-release file from
the infrastucture node to the deployment node. This way, the release discovery
logic will properly assess the openstack release even in situations where the
deployment node is isolated from the infra node.
If the openstack-release file is not found, an attempt to retrieve the
rpc-release file is made.

A conditional is added to check if the rpc-release file exist in the
environment. If it does, and there is no openstack-release file, then
the deployment version is set to Juno.

Co-Authored-By: git-harry <git-harry@live.co.uk>

Change-Id: I6136609ef11be7b98ddcfc7589dd17cf1e98c362
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/08/482608/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_openstack_release_filefunction get_openstack_release_file { notice "Getting openstack-release file from infra1 if it exists" # Get openstack_user_config.yml file path USER_CONFIG_FILE=$(find /etc/ -name '*_user_config.yml') # Get IP of os_infra node INFRA_IP=$(sed -n -e '/infra_hosts/, /ip:/ p' ${USER_CONFIG_FILE} | awk '/ip:/ {print $2; exit}') if [ -z "$INFRA_IP" ]; then notice "Could not find infra ip to get openstack-release file. Exiting.." exit 99 fi # Get the openstack-release file from the infra node. Don't fail if file doesn't exist scp -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@${INFRA_IP}:/etc/openstack-release /etc/openstack-release || true }

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/50/482950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash args="${@:-5671 5672}" for port in $args; do healthcheck_rabbitmq_ports="$healthcheck_rabbitmq_ports -i tcp:$port" done # check if sensu process opened rabbitmq port eval "lsof -nP $healthcheck_rabbitmq_ports| grep -q '^sensu*'" if $?; then exit 0 else ports=${args// /,} echo "There is no sensu process with opened RabbitMQ ports ($ports) running in the container" exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Wrap API module calls with KeyError handling

It happens that applications do not have keys that murano-dashboard
uses explicitly, such as 'name' or 'description'.
So, when some required keys are absent, handle appeared error
and provide error to user.

Change-Id: I66216e47d30d14f63ae3746f532a493e0a119fca

commit_message:
Partially implements expiration date alert message

The 'PASSWORD_EXPIRES_WARNING_THRESHOLD_DAYS' property will be
configured in the local_settings.py file; it will allow us to set the
number of days prior to the password date expiration that the user
will be warned to change their password.

Implements blueprint: password-expires-validation
Depends-On: Id66aa1c9596f8db8d07f63f3feb5166cb723a8e1

Change-Id: Iba30607154670ad09cea0d0cc57d9a3e0110c084
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/73/370973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Password will have an expiration day when using keystone v3 and enabling the # feature. # This setting allow to set the number of days that the user will be alerted # prior to the password expiration. # Once the password expires keystone will deny the access and users must # contact an admin to change their password. #TRESHOLD_DAYS = 7

commit_message:
Make Rabbit parameters consistent

The Qdr service appears to have hijacked these parameters for its
own use.  I don't think it should have done that in the first place,
but at least the parameter descriptions need to be kept consistent
with the other services.

Partial-Bug: 1700664
Change-Id: I6d9a075a99f33e9deacaf5b10a6ea7b0a234b942

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I099af10ea85d3d8a5314e0acf191dbfea1b5fc0f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 12:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-ansible-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7a47023343963e1dca6a7e01e9ace70e5e90cd40', 'message': "Increase job timeout for openstack-ansible

Also, recent work to implement rolling upgrades

Change-Id: I9075f06dc2e881dbc8642ada3f323edd522b9fae

commit_message:
Increase job timeout for openstack-ansible

With the demise of OSIC the openstack-ansible
integrated build is now being done more often
on much slower nodepool providers.

Also, recent work to implement rolling upgrades
have changed the way the initial deployment is
done and made it slower than before.

Unfortunately these two elements are now putting
us in the position where we're failing due to
a timeout more often than not, which is stalling
development.

This patch therefore increases the timeout by
30 mins.

Change-Id: I9075f06dc2e881dbc8642ada3f323edd522b9fae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/38/483338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timeout: 120

commit_message:
Fix OVS tunnel interface grep

Hardened the grep/awk that extracts the default interface for use
as the tunneling interface.  The command failed on multiple
Ubuntu machines as-was.

Change-Id: Ib7d0a8e55e67391d6cb7a58910cfc2ed617a4cbc

move link for lbaas dashboard to mitaka-eol tag

so we need to use the mitaka-eol tag instead to keep the dashboard
working as expected

commit_message:
tests: rework functional live tests

This allows to run functional live tests without devstack.
And runs tests within the normal tox target without devstack

This increases test coverage because all backend are now tested.

Change-Id: If475b6d1f43a44540f276209a3651e7e790c2233

commit_message:
Use 'sudo' to access /etc/sysconfig/heat-params

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437048/ changed the
permission of /etc/sysconfig/heat-params to 600, so non-file owners
would require use of 'sudo' in order to access the file. This patch
fixes it

Closes-Bug: #1704076
Change-Id: I8bb4a12deb92fa5035bbbb8fc6ce4736ed99ea78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/70/483270/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remote_exec $SSH_USER "sudo cat /etc/sysconfig/heat-params" heat-params remote_exec $SSH_USER "sudo cat /etc/sysconfig/heat-params" heat-params

commit_message:
doc: Enable pep8 on doc generation code

As pep8 does not run on doc generation python code so we have some
style violations there. As it not too hard to fix the problems and
therefore enable pep8 on these files this patch proposes such a
change.

Change-Id: I26104ea66fc4f3e67f8227025f43202e483beb25

commit_message:
VPNaaS integration with services flavor framework

* adds new attribute 'flavor_id' for vpnservice
* adds support for multiple drivers for VPNaaS

This solution uses a flavor of service type VPN associated with a flavor
profile containing a driver. During vpnservice creation, if a flavor_id
is passed, it is used to find the provider for the driver which would
handle the newly created vpnservice.  The flavor_id and the
provider-vpnservice association are pesisted in the DB.

ApiImpact and DocImpact tags are added as the new optional flavor_id
parameter should be described, as well as the support of multiple VPNaaS
drivers.

The original work and discussion about integrating VPNaaS and service
type framework can be found in the following change:
I9e195dfaee21b1cf204cb9b9fc773bc9e5af5936

ApiImpact
DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1672920

Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0095e160481f1d4572e38ad1d3bbc8e183039b84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/27/457527/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from neutron.db.models import l3agent from neutron.db import models_v2from neutron_lib import constants as lib_constants def _get_agent_hosting_vpn_services(self, context, host): plugin = directory.get_plugin() agent = plugin._get_agent_by_type_and_host( context, lib_constants.AGENT_TYPE_L3, host) agent_conf = plugin.get_configuration_dict(agent) # Retrieve the agent_mode to check if this is the # right agent to deploy the vpn service. In the # case of distributed the vpn service should reside # only on a dvr_snat node. agent_mode = agent_conf.get('agent_mode', 'legacy') if not agent.admin_state_up or agent_mode == 'dvr': return [] query = context.session.query(vpn_models.VPNService) query = query.join(vpn_models.IPsecSiteConnection) query = query.join(l3agent.RouterL3AgentBinding, l3agent.RouterL3AgentBinding.router_id == vpn_models.VPNService.router_id) query = query.filter( l3agent.RouterL3AgentBinding.l3_agent_id == agent.id) return query def _build_local_subnet_cidr_map(self, context): """Build a dict of all local endpoint subnets, with list of CIDRs.""" query = context.session.query(models_v2.Subnet.id, models_v2.Subnet.cidr) query = query.join(vpn_models.VPNEndpoint, vpn_models.VPNEndpoint.endpoint == models_v2.Subnet.id) query = query.join(vpn_models.VPNEndpointGroup, vpn_models.VPNEndpointGroup.id == vpn_models.VPNEndpoint.endpoint_group_id) query = query.join(vpn_models.IPsecSiteConnection, vpn_models.IPsecSiteConnection.local_ep_group_id == vpn_models.VPNEndpointGroup.id) return {sn.id: sn.cidr for sn in query.all()}

commit_message:
Bump minimal version of tempest to >= 16.1.0

This release includes tempest.lib.decorators (code moved from
tempest.test). The old location triggers deprecation warnings when
running tests.

Change-Id: I50b823b049d0e391ac517f7ec72380a12fa81176
